content.raw:
One possibility that jumps to mind is that dartsim by default will mesh-ify primitives when using FCL as a collision detector, because it used to [have known issues with primitive shapes](https://github.com/flexible-collision-library/fcl/issues/15). This was [fixed](https://github.com/flexible-collision-library/fcl/pull/52) as of version 0.4, but the the Xenial repo distributes 0.3 (although Bionic distributes 0.5, so maybe we can start to avoid this problem). If the sphere is being converted into a mesh, then it might be bouncing back and forth between two corners of that mesh.

But I'm just speculating about this being the cause. I'll take a deep dive into this example and see if I can identify the real issue.
